reviewText: Renee Fleming & Dmitri Hvorostovsky: A Musical Odyssey in St. PetersburgI am a big fan of Renee Fleming and Dmitri Hvorostovsky and that is why I knew that eventually I was going to buy this DVD.When I saw these two singers performing together in Eugene Oneguin aside of that they are very good singers they also have chemistry when they act together.The parts that I enjoyed the most were when they sang together, in this DVD they do some duets and they have to play different roles, like lovers, daughter and father, etc and they do it very well like those feelings are really true, they also sang different areas and songs very well.This DVD also can be very enjoyable for people that are not into opera because it also shows this beautiful city, its history and art as well as all the palaces they sang. Renee Fleming narrates episodes from the history of Saint Petersburg that can be also very interesting and with a lot of information that of course the DVD has to be watched more than once to get all this knowledge, but that is good if someone is going to buy a DVD is to see it many times and enjoy it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an absoutely GORGEOUS dvd,The singing is INCREDIBLE,The tour is totally AMAZING!!! If you're a fan of this two FABULOUS artists,this is a must have.Also discover the city of ST.PETERSBUG!!! It's all STUNNING!!!!

reviewText: TWO OF THE GREATEST SINGERS PERFORMING TODAY.  A BEAUTIFUL PRODUCTION WITH SONGS RARELY HEARD AND LOVINGLY PERFORMED.  BEAUTIFUL PHOTOGRAPHY IN THE PALACE AND IN ST. PETERSBURG.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.  ANYTHING BY RENEE AND DMITRI IS WORTH HAVING IN YOUR MUSIC COLLECTION.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Overall the program consists of a few Italian but mostly Russian composers.  I did not enjoy all the pieces but Renee's voice is marvelous.  I wish her wardrobe was comparable.  It looked as though she wraped herself in a bolt of fabric or curtains, very unflattering and looked like a crumpled mess.  The presentation in various beautiful palaces/museums in St Petersburg is well done and aesthically appealing compared to most staged performances in concert halls.  You even get a tour of the city in short segements.  The sound track quality is very good.  A very pleasing experience.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Having visited St. Petersburg, and not seeing all the sights, this DVD is a treasure especially in seeing the interior of the Hermitage.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I will add to the prior 18 high-praise reviewers only this observation.  IN EVERY RESPECT INCLUDING PRICE ($8.37 used) THIS CRASHES TO THE TOP OF MY ALL-TIME SHORT LIST FOR THE MOST SUPERLATIVE MUSICAL DVDs.I repeat, "in every respect".Higher praise have I not.
summary: The tour of the golden city + the fervent, impassioned, interactive, impassioned singing are both top of the line.
